TEXT: CARDINAL . The first applicant , an NORP citizen born in DATE and residing in GPE , is the chief editor and publisher of the newspaper “ FAC ” . The second applicant , a limited partnership ( Kommanditgesellschaft ) is the owner of this newspaper . The third applicant is a limited company , the general partner ( GPE ) of the second applicant . The second and third applicants have their places of business in GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicants belong to a large media group which at the relevant time was in strong competition with another media group represented by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . Besides his profession as a lawyer , PERSON was from DATE to DATE secretary general of ORG ( Österreichische Volkspartei ) and , from DATE , a Member of ORG for that party . DATE he was the Chairman of ORG ( ORG . DATE he represented the ORG competitor in several proceedings concerning unfair competition against companies belonging to the ORG media group .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE several NORP laws were amended by ORG Erweiterte PERSON - GPE ) . The Government PERSON ( PERSON ) had also provided for an amendment to LAW ( Exekutionsordnung ) , a section which is of particular relevance for the enforcement of injunctions . The Government PERSON had envisaged raising the fines that could be imposed for non - compliance with injunctions from ORG CARDINAL per enforcement order to ORG CARDINAL per enforcement order .

CARDINAL . NORP Under the chairmanship of PERSON , the ORG dealing with the Government PERSON proposed a different version , namely that a maximum fine of LAW could be imposed for each request for enforcement ( PERSON ) instead of for each enforcement order issued by ORG . In its report of DATE , ORG pointed out that the fine had to be multiplied by the number of requests for enforcement , if CARDINAL decision combining several requests was taken . This proposal was adopted by ORG on DATE and published as Article XI of the Extended Pecuniary Limits Amendment Act , ORG ( Erweiterte PERSON - Novelle CARDINAL , BGBl . CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . DATE , in DATE , the following article written by the first applicant under the pseudonym “ PERSON ” was published in the “ PERSON GPE ” :

Before PERSON became the NORP Minister for ORG , he was one of LOC ’s most famous and most successful lawyers . He administered the gigantic estate of Picasso ; he represented PERSON and an NORP Minister for ORG when the latter found himself in a bad situation . PERSON took it for granted that he had to give up his law firm when he became a member of the government . In every democracy of the world this course of action is followed . Only Mr Graff , who is obviously thick - skinned , does not intend to comply with these moral concepts .

It so happened that at the time when PERSON was presiding ORG , a law was amended which brought about big advantages for the newspaper publishers whom PERSON represented as a lawyer . In order to ensure that in such cases no suspicion , not even one that has no objective justification , can arise , there exists the wise rule of incompatibility ; a lawyer is not allowed to take part in the adoption of laws which lead to advantages for his clients .

Also the Austrian ORG thought that way and they decided to appeal to PERSON conscience . In vain ! It is very telling for the present situation of ORG that it can not convince PERSON . The other parties will be only too pleased , when it becomes so flagrantly evident how powerless ORG is vis - a - vis one of their officials who has his own moral concepts . PERSON was even allowed to present his disreputable attitude on our monopoly - television . PERSON thought that it would be a sign of fear to the ‘ PERSON if he had to resign from ORG .

ORG does not have to fear the ‘ Krone’ but its voters , who will continue turning away from it if the party shows itself incapable of establishing order within its own ranks ; how could CARDINAL then possibly trust that it would succeed in doing this in the ORG ... Cato . ”
